name: doing
content:
doing noun
(ACTION)
be someone's doing [ U ]
Add to word list
Add to word list
to be done or caused by someone: Is this your doing? (= Did you do this?) It was not my doing. See also
deed (ACTION) take some doing [ U ]
to be difficult to do and need a lot of effort: Running a marathon takes some/a lot of doing. doings [ plural ] UK
someone's activities: The doings of the British royal family have always been of interest to the media.

doing noun
(THING)
doings [ C ] UK informal plural doings
anything, especially a small object, whose name you have forgotten or do not know: I'm looking for a doings to hold up a curtain rail that's fallen down.
